availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Edward Mitchell (Boyle County, Kentucky, clerk and agent for Liverpool and London)

body.p: Boyle County, Kentucky, clerk and banker. Boyle County, Kentucky, native. Son of Thomas Mitchell and Mary A. Mitchell. Married to Blanche "Bettie" Prather Mitchell in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on December 20, 1859. Father of Louisa Mitchell and Jessie Mitchell. Attended school in Boyle County in 1850. Household owned ten enslaved persons in Boyle County in 1850. Attended Centre College in Boyle County in 1851. Clerk in Boyle County in 1860. Household owned five enslaved persons in Boyle County in 1860. Clerk in Boyle County in 1863. Agent for the Liverpool and London Globe Insurance Company in 1864. Banker in partnership with Henry S. Julian and Thomas D. Tilford in H.S. Julian & Company in Louisville in 1865.
